Machine learning is a subset of AI that enables systems to learn patterns from data without being explicitly programmed.
Deep learning is a type of machine learning using neural networks with multiple layers to model complex patterns in data.
A neural network is a computational model inspired by the human brain, consisting of layers of interconnected nodes that process information.
AI is a broader concept of machines simulating human intelligence, while ML is a subset of AI focusing on learning from data.
Python and R are the most popular programming languages for data science due to their extensive libraries and ease of use.
Data preprocessing involves cleaning, transforming, and preparing raw data to improve the performance of machine learning models.
Common methods to handle missing data include deletion, imputation, or using algorithms that support missing values.
Feature engineering is the process of selecting, transforming, or creating new input variables to improve a machine learning model.
Supervised learning uses labeled data for training, while unsupervised learning finds patterns in unlabeled data.
Overfitting occurs when a model learns noise in the training data instead of general patterns, leading to poor performance on new data.
I was created by the team Syntax Sultans: Pavan, Anuja and Neethika.
Agile is an iterative and flexible software development methodology focused on collaboration, customer feedback, and rapid delivery of small, functional increments.
SDLC is a structured process for planning, designing, developing, testing, and deploying software.
Functional requirements define what a system should do, while non-functional requirements define how it should perform.
An API (Application Programming Interface) allows different software systems to communicate with each other.
White-box testing examines internal code logic, while black-box testing focuses on input-output behavior.
